job_description:
HunaTek is searching for a Project Analyst/Policy Advisor that will provide support services to a government client in Washington, DC. This position is contingent upon contract award.
Essential Job Functions:
Working with the Senior Advisors, Special Assistant, and other team members to ensure that the Special Envoy’s engagements and interventions are strategically balanced and aligned to leverage priorities and advance the Office’s various lines of efforts.
Assist the Special Envoy with the preparation of high-level public engagements and events, consulting with other team members when necessary
Accompany the Special Envoy and their team on trips domestically and internationally, when needed.
Support the Special Envoy’s Senior Advisors to coordinate policy formulation with other bureaus and offices across the Department as well as with interagency counterparts.
Track specific policy issues across the building, as tasked, to ensure the Special Envoy and their team are weighing in as appropriate.
Build and/or strengthen working relationships with key building or interagency stakeholders, as tasked.
Make recommendations to Senior Advisors for how SEA WGH can strategically collaborate with other Department and interagency offices that have equities.
Support timely and streamlined information-sharing across S/GWI, the building, and the interagency, including through the clearance process and regular touch-bases with assigned counterparts.
Integrate SEA WGH priorities and messaging into building paper, talking points, and reports, as tasked.
Support the Special Envoy’s Senior Advisor on the USACM, including operations, partnerships, communications, and coordination.
Make recommendations for iteratively aligning the USACM’s structure with stated priorities
Support USACM partner coordination, communication, and relationship-building.
Support the development of internal and public-facing communication materials and channels regarding the USACM.
Work closely with USACM partners to prep stakeholders and policy makers for engagements, as tasked.
Support information sharing on the USACM with other international consultative platforms.
Assist in circulating USACM outputs and recommendations across the Department, the interagency, and, as appropriate, with likeminded countries.
Serve as the primary lead for any public-facing USACM events, including high-level events involving USG leadership, in collaboration with the Senior Advisor.

Education and Qualifications Required:
MA or other advanced degree in international relations, political science, gender studies, economics, history, or another relevant area of study.
Experience advising and providing strategic support to senior leadership.
Experience working on women’s rights and/or human rights in Afghanistan.
Experience directing programs to advance human rights and women’s leadership.
Experience with developing and implementing management systems and processes.
Excellent interpersonal and communication, both written and oral, skills.
Experience in programming and event planning.
Ability to manage multiple tasks, coordinate activities in multiple locations, act decisively in daily work, and work well in a multicultural team environment.
About Us:

At HunaTek, we build teams of people from all backgrounds with varying levels of experience, knowing firsthand that diversity of thought will strengthen our ability to deliver for our customers. We work hand in hand with Federal civilian and military staff, pulling together to further the interests of our nation and home and abroad.
Whenever possible, we provide opportunities for our employees to learn new skills, obtain certifications, attend industry events, and have some fun together.
Our Benefits:
We offer a comprehensive benefits package designed to make sure our employees and their families have access to good health care, are insured against catastrophic health events, can put money aside for retirement and are able to maintain a healthy work-life balance. These benefits include:
Comprehensive medical, dental and vision
Long-term and short-term disability insurance and term life insurance
401(K) with safe harbor contribution
Paid time off and 11 paid holidays
Tuition and career development assistance
A selection of voluntary benefits

ADA: HunaTek will make reasonable accommodations in compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990.
EEO/AA: HunaTek does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, religion, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, height, weight, or marital status in employment or the provision of services and is an equal access/equal opportunity/affirmative action employer.

Position Summary
Every role at Samsung presents a new opportunity to make a lasting, global impact. We believe that innovation
and growth are driven by an inclusive culture and a diverse workforce. We’re seeking innovators to create a global team where everyone belongs and has equal opportunities, inspiring our talent to be their true selves. Together, we are building a better tomorrow for our customers, partners and communities.

Join the Samsung family and be part of the team that’s creating a better future.
Role and Responsibilities
The Director of Government Relations will continue to strengthen Samsung’s relationships with Congressional and White House Administration officials; help secure legislative and policy outcomes that align with Samsung’s business objectives; and build Samsung’s brand with key Washington stakeholders. Support Government Relations teams’ efforts to advance Samsung’s legislative initiatives that align with Samsung’s business interests. Participate in political events on behalf of Samsung’s political action committee.
Help develop legislative strategy in order to implement key policy issues of importance to Samsung’s business
Help block harmful legislation/policy measures
Organize and execute site visits to Samsung facilities with key federal, state and local elected officials
Develop strategies and programmatic activities in collaboration with Communications team to drive Members of Congress/Administration officials to Samsung Solutions Center in DC
Attend political events and help host fundraisers for Samsung America PAC
Help develop coalitions to advance Samsung’s policy objectives with other companies, trade associations and industry stakeholders engaging in legislative and administration advocacy
Represent the company before the White House, Congress, and federal agencies; strengthen existing relationships with Congressional Members and Administration officials and staff and build new ones to further build Samsung’s brand
Increase awareness among government officials on Samsung policy positions, presence in the US and position as a global leader of consumer electronics, device solutions and other businesses
Research and analyze legislation and Administration actions and regulator proposals. Prepare briefings and reports for internal stakeholders that identify opportunities or risks of those measures.
Attend congressional hearings; trade associations meetings and report on related activities.
Assist Government Relations team in formulating a disbursement plan to support federal Congressional candidates through the Samsung America PAC.
Provide written updates on legislative bills and activities. Track bills impacting the tech industry.
Attend political events and help host fundraisers for Samsung America PAC
Skills and Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications & Experience
Established relationships on Capitol Hill, particularly with the House Energy and Commerce, House Ways and Means, Senate Finance, Senate Commerce, and House and Senate Foreign Relations and Appropriations Committees, among others.
10+ years of experience working on Capitol Hill, the Administration, or lobbying in the private sector or for a trade association.
Willingness to register as a lobbyist.
Outstanding and persuasive communication skills, both verbal and written
Proficient knowledge of legislative processes and procedures.
Outstanding and persuasive communication skills, both verbal and written.
Ability to provide critical analysis and develop political strategies.
Outstanding people skills.
Ability to influence others and work across the aisle.
Available to attend events and meetings outside work hours.
Occasional domestic, international travel to Samsung facilities and industry events, conferences as appropriate
Juris Doctor or Masters Degree preferred
Knowledge of the congressional appropriations process, tax, science, and/or energy issues
Experience working with key Congressional caucuses, and coalitions
PowerPoint, Excel skills

What We're Building + Who We Work With

Hustle enables organizations to run large-scale text messaging campaigns by empowering their team members and volunteers to efficiently have thousands of personal 1-to-1 conversations. Communication driven by our platform is geared towards driving measurable, meaningful outcomes such as voter turnout, event attendance, or dollars raised for clients including Planned Parenthood, NAACP, Sierra Club, many large non-profits, unions, and universities, as well as hundreds of political campaigns.
Details

Position Type: Full-time, salaried
Location: Remote in certain US states - CA, CT, DC, FL, GA, MA, MD, NC, NH, NY, VA
Reports to: SVP, Gov't Affairs & Political Partners
Salary Range: $65K Salary / $10K Commission ($75K OTE)

What you'll do
Uncover the path of least resistance to close new accounts in political, government and non profit markets
Work as a team with an SDR to prospect into target organizations via email outreach, cold calling, networking, email, social media, text messaging, and other digital marketing channels
Gain perspective on a variety of industries as you develop unique pitches for each stakeholder delivering unique insights to how Hustle's solution can impact business performance
As a product advocate, articulate Hustle's value proposition to key influencers and decision-makers across multiple industries to assess buying interest to both technical & economic buyers
Using your deft communication skills easily navigate across conversations with diplomacy and tact in all interactions
Record activities in CRM – Salesforce, tracking progress notes within key accounts
We are looking for someone with
1+ years of proven success in SaaS or comparable sales
Experience in legislative, political, government and non profit markets
Comprehensive technical knowledge is preferred
Demonstrated ability of performing daily demos, cold calling and leveraging web conferencing tools
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, as well as collaboration skills
Ability to work and learn in a fast-paced team environment
We hope you have
Eagerness to make an impact at Hustle. Thrive in a fast-moving, dynamic, hyper-growth environment
A track record of developing ways to genuinely understand customers, and using that information to help them
Exceptional collaboration and relationship-building skills – with the ability to develop relationships and influence functional groups at all levels of management, both inside and outside Hustle
Hustle's Benefits / Perks
Working with a mission-driven team that celebrates the diversity of its members
Top of market equity included in your compensation package
Full medical, dental, and vision insurance

Hustle is an excellent team because of the diverse backgrounds of our staff. This includes professional background, subject matter expertise, culture, race/ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, language, political beliefs, and hobbies. We sincerely encourage women, minorities, and people from underrepresented backgrounds to apply.

Hustle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, pursuant to laws applicable in Washington D.C. and the fair chance ordinance of San Francisco.

job_description: We are seeking a Public Policy Analyst to ensure the Department of Human Services (DHS) is equipped to navigate and respond to impactful policy and legislative changes. This role monitors actions taken by federal, state, and local government agencies/legislative bodies in order to identify and analyze implications for human services clients, programs, and funding. The position is highly visible within DHS, having responsibility for informing the Director, Deputies, and other leaders about public policy impacts and coordinating DHS’s response. Further, this position helps to manage DHS’s relationships with key government officials and staff.This is an exciting opportunity to support local leaders in designing effective ways of providing services and improving program quality, including enhancing clients’ experiences with programs and services. This position is based within Allegheny County Department of Human Services(DHS).Who Are We?Great Lakes Research (GL) is a leading provider of professional services and technology products designed specifically for the human service, education, and public and non-profit sectors.Our headquarters are located in Cranberry Township, PA with additional offices in Gateway Center, downtown Pittsburgh and other locations in the Pittsburgh area. Great Lakesprovides staffing services to multiple Allegheny County divisions in the following areas:IT SupportAdministrative SupportData Analysis, Evaluation and ResearchProject ManagersWho Are You?You are results-focused, highly-adaptable and collaborative. You have a rare set of skills, including the ability to plan, write, analyze, organize, and coordinate projects.Who is the Office of Analytics, Technology and Planning?The Office of Analytics, Technology and Planning(ATP) supports policy development, quality improvement, planning and decision-making through research, analysis and engagement to improve the delivery of human services to Allegheny County's most vulnerable residents.What Will You Be Responsible For?Establishing the systems and relationships needed to anticipate, analyze, and respond to administrative and legislative policy changes. This includes:-- Developing working relationships with officials and staff, affinity organizations and associations, other human services agencies, and DHS Deputies and other leaders; and-- Establishing mechanisms for quickly identifying, and organizing DHS’s response to, changes in federal/state policy and legislation impacting human services (e.g., Family First and IV-E waiver; privacy laws that affect data management; etc.).Organizing DHS’s response to administrative and legislative changes, by sharing information about their anticipated impact with DHS leaders and helping them plan for resultant impacts to practice, processes, and revenue.Presenting policy analyses to DHS leaders and other stakeholders.Representing DHS in communications with other County Departments and state (e.g., PA DHS) and federal agencies (e.g., HHS and HUD), as needed.Maintaining a current understanding of DHS’s revenue sources and supporting budgeting and accounting functions at DHS with information about relevant policy frameworks and funding rules and regulations.Contributing expertise and specialized skills (writing and analysis) to key Planning team deliverables, including proposal development and the preparation of state-required plans and budgets.What Background and Skills Does the Ideal Candidate Have?Bachelor’s degree in public policy, public administration, political science, or a related field, plus 2+ years of relevant experience.Knowledge of:-- State and federal policymaking processes as well as state and federal legislative authorities and funding mechanisms relevant to human services.-- Appropriations and authorization legislation.-- Relevant advocacy channels and organizations.-- Functions and operations of publicly-funded human services.-- The organization and structure of governments within Allegheny County (e.g., County, City, other municipal).·Ability to:-- Analyze, synthesize and translate complex information to inform decisions.o Conduct detailed policy research and prepare written summaries and reports.-- Create new processes and procedures to enable position objectives.-- Establish and maintain effective and collaborative working relationships with DHS leaders, staff and partners.-- Manage multiple projects and complete them accurately and on time.-- Publicly present and write with clarity.We know that many strong candidates will not have all the listed skills and that is ok. What else do you bring to the table?Job LocationThis is an onsite, office position based at the Allegheny County Department of Human Services in downtown Pittsburgh, PA.If hired, candidates would be employed by GL and assigned to Allegheny County Office of Analytics, Technology and Planning.BenefitsGL benefits include:Medical, dental and vision insuranceGenerous paid time off: vacation, sick, personal, and bereavementGroup term life and AD & D insuranceShort- and long-term disabilityEmployee Assistance Program401K/403B Matching PlanFlexible Spending Accounts (FSA)COVID RequirementsApplicants will have to be vaccinated from COVID-19 as a condition of employment, subject to federal and state laws. You will need to be fully vaccinated from COVID-19 before beginning work and will be required to provide proof of full vaccination.AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER - M/F/V/DJob Type: Full-timeBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceEmployee assistance programFlexible spending accountHealth insuranceLife insurancePaid time offVision insuranceSchedule:Monday to FridayAbility to commute/relocate:Pittsburgh, PA 15222: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)Education:Bachelor's (Required)Work Location: One location

job_titles: Associate on Public Policy and Government Affairs - TSM
job_description:
Associate on Public Policy and Government Affairs
Guaynabo, PR
ABOUT US
At Grupo Triple S, we are committed to provide meaningful job experiences for Valuable People (Gente Valiosa). We encourage an environment of very high ethical standards, always excelling in service, collaboration among the company, agility to deliver timely, and embracing accountability for results.
When you join Grupo Triple S, you will be key to our efforts on delivering high-quality and affordable healthcare as well as contribute to our purpose to enable healthier lives. We serve more than 1 million consumers in Puerto Rico through our Medicare Advantage, Medicaid, Commercial, Life and Property & Casualty Businesses.
Let's build healthier communities together, join now!
ABOUT THE ROLE
The Associate on Public Policy and Government Affairs is primarily responsible for assisting the Legal Counsel Public Policy and Government Affairs (LGPGA) in the management of public policy and government affairs efforts, as well as other policy related operational matters. He/she provides support to the LGPPGA in strategic projects delegated by the Chief Legal Officer and the Chief Executive Officer and other top management leaders and assists with the coordination with outside government affairs consultants and advisors, both at the local and federal level.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
Serves as key staff support to the (LGPPGA).
Tracks government and policy-related news, publications, and other information from a variety of sources.
Assists in development of written materials to keep the organization informed about government and policy developments, identifying impact to the company.
Provides support in the preparation of testimonies and position papers related to public policy matters.
Provides support in the analysis and interpretation of proposed bills and regulation, laws, rulings, and regulations.
Represents the LGPGA in meetings of interest groups and trade organizations such as the Medicaid and Medicare Advantage Products Association (MMAPA).
Collaborates in the coordination of work and strategies to influence trade associations and other healthcare advocacy organizations including MMAPA, with the approval of the LGPGA.
Provides support in the coordination of efforts with outside government affairs consultants and advisors, both at the local and federal level.
Provides support in the development of policies and strategies to advance Company’s business goals and objectives.
Provides support in the coordination, development and execution of the company’s public policy and government affair efforts and agenda.
Works consistently with internal and external subject matters experts to develop deep knowledge of the Company’s public policy and government relations priorities and the potential policy implications to the Company.
Supports the coordination of internal and external meetings with stakeholders and government officials to help achieving the Company’s goals and objectives.
Provide project management and administrative support.
Perform other duties as assigned.
WHAT YOU'LL BRING
BA/BS degree in Political Science, Government, or a related field and a Juris Doctor from an accredited law school.Master’s Degree in Public Administration or Public Policy is desirable. At least 3 years of experience in legislative, political, administrative and government activities (State & Federal); or any combination of experience that would provide an equivalent background. Experience relating to healthcare policy, insurance and business is required. Knowledge on issues related to CMS, HHS, ASES, Medicaid & Medicare, OIC regulations, are preferred. Fully Bilingual.
CLOSING DATE: 3/31/2023
It is company policy to seek for the qualified applicants for positions throughout the company without distinction of race, color, national origin, religion, gender, gender identity, real or perceived sexual orientation, civil status, social condition, political ideologies, age, physical or mental disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. Drug-free company.
Equality Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action for Minorities/Females/People with Disabilities/Veterans”. Employer with E-Verify to verify the eligibility of employment of all the new employees.
We encourage Females, Veterans and Disabled to Apply

DutiesProvide support to the General Counsel, including In-take, electronic filings to regulatory agencies; contract drafting/formatting; Support all other counsels in the department, if necessary. (40%)Adheres to and ensure compliance with document management protocols within the department. Produces information by transcribing, formatting, inputting, editing, retrieving, copying, and transmitting text, data, and graphics. Secures information by completing data base backups. Provides historical reference by developing and utilizing filing and retrieval systems; recording meeting discussions. Facilitates execution of contracts. (10%)Conserves executive's time by reading, researching, and routing correspondence; drafting letters and documents; collecting and analyzing information. Maintains executive's appointment schedule by planning and scheduling meetings, conferences, teleconferences, and travel. (10%)Welcomes guests and customers by greeting them, in person or on the telephone; answering or directing inquiries. Maintains office supplies inventory by checking stock to determine inventory level; anticipating needed supplies; evaluating new office products; placing and expediting orders for supplies; verifying receipt of supplies. (10%)Performs and completes other legal special projects. Prepares reports by collecting and analyzing information. (10%)Responsible for the administrative functions that includes supporting the General Counsel on Board matters and other related legal projects. (10%)Perform other duties as assigned. (10%)Education RequiredAssociate's DegreeIn lieu of degree, equivalent education and/or experience may be considered.Education PreferredBachelor's DegreeJob Type: Full-timeSchedule:8 hour shiftEducation:Associate (Preferred)Experience:Legal support: 4 years (Preferred)Executive Support: 4 years (Preferred)Heavy Calendaring: 4 years (Preferred)Work Location: On the road

Responsibilities
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

At TikTok, our people are humble, intelligent, compassionate and creative. We create to inspire - for you, for us, and for more than 1 billion users on our platform. We lead with curiosity and aim for the highest, never shying away from taking calculated risks and embracing ambiguity as it comes. Here, the opportunities are limitless for those who dare to pursue bold ideas that exist just beyond the boundary of possibility. Join us and make impact happen with a career at TikTok.

We are looking for a highly motivated, collaborative and detail-oriented coordinator to join the TikTok public policy team. Our team supports the business in its legislative and regulatory matters. You will work across the North and South Americas public policy teams to help manage organization response to government and stakeholder inquiries and support the subject matter expert teams. We are looking for a self-starter with excellent project management skills who is ready to learn and capable of coordinating multiple stakeholders and different functions across cultures and time zones.

Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain accurate project timelines, master project calendar, work-back schedules, meetings notes, tracking documents, and other documentation as needed; foresee and triage blockers and issues before they arise.
Build and maintain relationships with teams across the company.
Serve as a point of contact for select external stakeholders.
Help coordinate written responses to external inquiries to the company and to prepare internal stakeholders for meetings or events.
Provide administrative, logistical, and organizational support for the subject matter expert team, including handling scheduling, presentations, team related procedures and objectives.

Qualifications

The ideal candidate is a humble, curious, and skilled listener, communicator and relationship-builder.
Comfort in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Prepared to work with minimal guidance, take action on urgent priorities, and act with a high level of discretion when handling confidential information.
Capable of quickly shifting and changing course based on new information or high-priority requests.
2+ years of professional experience.
A problem-solver experienced at remaining focused and calm when problems come your way.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please reach out to us at Recruiting.Corp@tiktok.com

We’re changing the way people connect to social care.
Findhelp launched over 10 years ago in Austin, TX and has helped millions of people. We make it easy to find food, health, housing, and employment programs in seconds at findhelp.org.
As a certified B Corp, we are driven to do good, we’re powered by tech, and looking for passionate people to join our team. Our mission is to connect all people in need and the programs that serve them (with dignity and ease).
If our mission resonates with you, we’d love for you to keep reading.
The Public Affairs Marketing Strategist will align findhelp’s branding, messaging, and public policy thought leadership with effective and accessible digital, social, and marketing content. The ideal candidate has a strong grasp of public policy, political communications, and marketing tactics. They have a record of understanding complex ideas and translating them into diverse types of content that are relevant and accessible for a broad range of audiences.
Responsibilities and Duties:
Work closely with the company’s leadership and policy team to translate complex ideas into appropriate content for a variety of stakeholder audiences.
Maintain and update libraries of content, including presentation decks, white papers, case studies, thought leadership blog posts, and other material for use in a variety of presentations.
Work closely with internal clients to translate content for a variety of settings including webinars, conferences, sales pitches, and presentations.
Work with brand affinity creative talent (including documentary and podcast creators) on strategies to push affinity content to key audiences through multiple strategies, including social.
Coordinate with People Operations and senior leaders to create internal communications content for findhelp staff to communicate important updates, tips, and reminders
Manage the internal communications tools including newsletter, internal education materials, and monthly all-company meetings.
Maintain an editorial calendar and build strategies to push brand affinity content to target audiences.
Qualifications:
5-7 years of experience in relevant positions
Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, Public Relations, Public Affairs or related field required.
Public policy background a must
Exceptional communication and public policy translation skills (presentation, written, and verbal)
Ability to connect with a variety of audiences from individual contributors to executives and from technical to non-technical employees.
Familiarity with WordPress, HubSpot, and social media platforms
Knowledge of social services, health care, and social work preferred
Some travel is required.
Perks at findhelp401k & stock optionsFree food and onsite gym at our Austin HQ andDiscounted gym membershipsPaid parental leaveCompetitive PTO & 10 paid holidaysHealth, dental, and vision insurancePet-friendly office with attached dog park at our Austin HQ24/7 access to telemedicine and counselingBook Purchasing ProgramTuition Program for Curation
We’re building a diverse, inclusive team
You’re welcome here. We want everyone to be able to easily connect to the help they need, and we want our teams to reflect and represent our communities. It is our policy to recruit, hire, train, and promote individuals, as well as administer any and all Company policies, without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin or ancestry, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, creed, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, or any other protected class, in accordance with applicable laws. Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities.
Here are some of the ways we support our staff:Culture CommitteeLeadership Development TrainingPaid Volunteering Time

General Summary: We're currently seeking a Policy Analyst III to procure support services to assist CBER/OM/DPS with reviewing and processing of Confidential Financial Disclosure Reports (OGE-450) and working with the Ethics Team in translating requirements and policies for the review of CBER’s financial disclosure reports.
Essential Job Functions:
Work with the Ethics Team in reviewing and processing of Confidential Financial Disclosure Reports (OGE-450)
Work with the Ethics Team in translating requirements and policies for the review of CBER’s financial disclosure reports
Work with the Ethics Team in developing and maintaining resources, Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), and templates for the review of financial disclosure reports
Work with the Director and other leadership to ensure financial disclosure reports are technically accurate for certification of conflicts
Other related duties as assigned.
Education Requirement: Bachelor’s Degree
Experience Requirement: Minimum six (6) years of related experience. Experience with Microsoft Office Suite, ability to address numerous and often conflicting interrelated issues and factors, that in most cases, would require the diplomatic handling of sensitive issues, knowledge of, or the ability to learn, the organization and functions of CBER, FDA, and other DHHS components with which the office regularly interacts as well as other areas including major scientific developments, and skill in communication, a considerable degree of tact, and ability to persuade and to arbitrate.
Other Requirement(s): This position requires U.S. Citizenship or a Green Card holder and the ability to obtain and maintain a Government public trust level security clearance. For a candidate that is a Green Card holder, they must have lived in the United States for at least three out of the past five years prior to your application date. You will also meet the residency qualifications if you lived abroad while on government or military duty or if you were a dependent of a federal employee of military member.
Performance Requirements:
Must possess demonstrated knowledge and experience applying analytic methodologies and principles to address client needs.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
Ability to work independently.
Ability to establish and maintain effective and positive working relationships with all staff and visitors.
Equipment Operated: Standard office equipment including computers, fax machines, copiers, printers, telephones, etc.
Work Environment: Work performed in an office environment. Involves frequent contact with staff and customers.
Mental/Physical Requirements: Manual dexterity for office machine operation; stooping, bending to handle files and supplies, mobility to complete errands or deliveries. Must be able to remain in stationary position for extended periods of time. Stress can be triggered by multiple demands and deadlines.

They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, skills, efforts, requirements, or working conditions. Policy Analyst II
Rockville MD

Public Trust Eligible


Position Overview:

Nationwide IT Services is seeking a Policy Analyst II. This role would focus on working towards the health of racial and ethnic minority populations through the development of health policies and programs that will help eliminate health disparities.

Duties and Responsibilities:
Provide subject matter expertise to inform the development and improvement of outputs and deliverables from OMH program and policy initiatives focused on racial and ethnic health disparities and health equity.
Provide substantive review of technical documents and other materials from OMH program and policy initiatives focused on racial and ethnic health disparities and health equity.
Participate actively as a subject matter expert in meetings on programmatic and policy efforts.
Support the documentation of progress, milestones, and core achievements, and reporting to OMH leadership.
Works with the Program Office to identify and resolve complex problems.
Has responsibility for several projects, simultaneously.


Job Qualifications:
Bachelors Degree in related field.
Must have a minimum of six (6) years of relevant work experience.
Excellent written/verbal communication and multi-tasking skills.
Must be US Citizen or Authorized to Work in the United States.
Ability to obtain and retain a Public Trust Clearance.


About Nationwide IT Services
NIS is an IT and Management consulting company, designated 8(a) by the SBA, and a CVE-verified Service Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business. Our mission is to deliver value-added services to our customers, leveraging technology, people, and industry best practices to implement innovative solutions through our trusted employees and team members.

Our benefits package includes medical, dental, and vision insurance, life and disability insurance, 401(k) plan with employer match, paid holidays, PTO (sick/vacation), commuter benefits, employee assistance program (EAP) and educational reimbursement.

Nationwide IT Services, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetics, disability or protected veteran status.

About the Organization
Now is a great time to join Redhorse Corporation. Redhorse specializes in developing and implementing creative strategies and solutions with private, state, and federal customers in the areas of cultural and environmental resources services, climate and energy change, information technology, and intelligence services. We are hiring creative, motivated, and talented people with a passion for doing what's right, what's smart, and what works.
Position Description
Redhorse Corporation has an opening for a Legislative Affairs Specialist on a task with the Office of Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy (EERE). The Ideal candidate should have extensive working knowledge of the concepts for evaluating, implementing, maintaining, and enhancing programmatic support and control systems, and functional organizations.
Primary Responsibilities for the Legislative Affairs Specialist include:
Provide, on a quick-turnaround basis, objective analysis, both quantitative and qualitative, on a wide variety of legislative, regulatory, stakeholder, and programmatic issues
Track and report the progress of legislative bills and initiatives
Coordinate the development of policy-oriented and legislative materials, including briefings, PowerPoint decks, memos, and other materials
Monitor and report on federal and state legislative initiatives, new and emerging technologies, and a wide range of potential and real issues and policies impacting the EERE technology offices and programs
Prepare briefing materials and prepare DOE senior management for briefings to Congress, including committees, individual members, and staff. Due dates, format and content of briefing materials is to be mutually agreed to between the contractor and government
Conduct budget briefings in conjunction with the Congressional budget cycle to audiences including DOE leadership
Handle multiple projects at the same time
Basic Requirements for Experience, Skills, Education, and Credentials include:
B.S. or B.A. in Business Management, Public Policy, Public Affairs, Political Economy, Political Science, Sociology, Economics, Engineering, Science, or other appropriate discipline plus 6 years of Hill/Senate/House experience.
Proficient using Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Power Point, Outlook)
Effective oral and written communication and conflict resolution skills
Executive Order Requirement:
While currently on HOLD, Redhorse recognizes that we may need to comply with Executive Order 14042 which requires Federal Contractors to ensure all U.S. new hires be fully vaccinated for COVID-19. As required by the Executive Order, Redhorse will work in coordination with applicable contract agencies to consider requests for Reasonable Accommodations.

Redhorse Corporation shall, in its discretion, modify or adjust the position to meet Redhorse’s changing needs.
This job description is not a contract and may be adjusted as deemed appropriate in Redhorse’s sole discretion.

We’re changing the way people connect to social care.
Findhelp launched over 10 years ago in Austin, TX and has helped millions of people. We make it easy to find food, health, housing, and employment programs in seconds at findhelp.org.
As a certified B Corp, we are driven to do good, we’re powered by tech, and looking for passionate people to join our team. Our mission is to connect all people in need and the programs that serve them (with dignity and ease).
If our mission resonates with you, we’d love for you to keep reading.
The Public Affairs Marketing Strategist will align findhelp’s branding, messaging, and public policy thought leadership with effective and accessible digital, social, and marketing content. The ideal candidate has a strong grasp of public policy, political communications, and marketing tactics. They have a record of understanding complex ideas and translating them into diverse types of content that are relevant and accessible for a broad range of audiences.
Responsibilities and Duties:
Work closely with the company’s leadership and policy team to translate complex ideas into appropriate content for a variety of stakeholder audiences.
Maintain and update libraries of content, including presentation decks, white papers, case studies, thought leadership blog posts, and other material for use in a variety of presentations.
Work closely with internal clients to translate content for a variety of settings including webinars, conferences, sales pitches, and presentations.
Work with brand affinity creative talent (including documentary and podcast creators) on strategies to push affinity content to key audiences through multiple strategies, including social.
Coordinate with People Operations and senior leaders to create internal communications content for findhelp staff to communicate important updates, tips, and reminders
Manage the internal communications tools including newsletter, internal education materials, and monthly all-company meetings.
Maintain an editorial calendar and build strategies to push brand affinity content to target audiences.
Qualifications:
5-7 years of experience in relevant positions
Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, Public Relations, Public Affairs or related field required.
Public policy background a must
Exceptional communication and public policy translation skills (presentation, written, and verbal)
Ability to connect with a variety of audiences from individual contributors to executives and from technical to non-technical employees.
Familiarity with WordPress, HubSpot, and social media platforms
Knowledge of social services, health care, and social work preferred
Some travel is required.

We support democracy.
Our vision at Election Systems & Software (ES&S) is simple and unwavering — we provide products and services of exceptional quality and value to maintain voter confidence and enhance the voting experience. We accomplish this through continuous investments in research and development, resulting in regular product updates and security enhancements for each voting system we design, build, sell and support.
Join the ES&S team where we are crafting the future of voting in the United States! On our team, you will push boundaries to provide solutions that meet the industry’s ever-evolving needs. Our people apply their innovative perspective to challenges big and small, and ES&S provides the resources to make our employees’ vision a reality.
Summary/Objective: An Election Services Associate is responsible for layout and precise composition of basic election ballots using databases and graphic design applications. The position requires accurate translation of customer election requirements into coded election machine instructions. This position requires exceptional attention to detail, accuracy of data entry and quality of work product.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Develop the ability to apply the full array of appropriate federal, state, and local election requirements and industry protocols to the layout, presentation and organization of ballots and the coded instructions prepared for customers’ voting system hardware.
Compose and layout election ballots and translate ballot layout to coded machine instructions meeting the specifications of assigned customers.
Facilitate product proofing and quality assurance processes to assure zero error translation to coded instructions.
Produce and transmit accurate, precise electronic layout files to ensure vendor printers generate zero-defect ballot materials.
Communicate directly with customers, providing quality resolutions of customer issues and questions including but not limited to election forms, requests related to products and services; coordinate issues’ resolution through appropriate subject matter expert; organize workflow, document and follow-up as required to meet commitments.
Provide required diagnostics, and support to enable customer-managed development of electronic ballots using ES&S proprietary software products.
This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.
Education: An associates’ degree in business administration or computer technology field is preferred; or equivalent combination of education and experience
Experience: At least 1 year experience including:
Experience with Adobe Acrobat, Excel and Microsoft Office Suite
Competencies:
Technical capacity to learn Unity Suite including Ballot Image Manager (BIM); Election Data Manager (EDM); Hardware Programming Manager (HPM); Election Reporting Manager (ERM); Ballot on Demand (BOD); Electionware Voting System; NEWS; ES&S Portal
Effective communication skills including the ability to interpret verbal and written material
Problem Solving/Analytical ability
Detail orientation/ Precision
Licenses/Certifications Required: None
Travel: Approximately 10 - 15% travel is expected. Expect overnight travel four (4) to five (5) times annually to attend meetings and participate in election support.

At PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL), we believe that every person has the right to participate fully in the global economy. Our mission is to democratize financial services to ensure that everyone, regardless of background or economic standing, has access to affordable, convenient, and secure products and services to take control of their financial lives.
Job Description Summary: US Federal GR Manager
Job Description:
The US Federal Government Relations Manager will work closely with the Head of GR North America to set goals and execute strategies relating to Federal public policy. The Manager will play a lead role in the implementation of agreed tactics, working in tandem with team members and external consultants, whom the Manager will assist in managing. This individual will be expected to identify critical stakeholders on issues and manage effective engagement with those persons and entities.
The primary focus of work shall relate to financial services and other issues impacting PayPal’s business, which include trade and barriers to commerce, tax, privacy and cybersecurity. Depending on the candidate’s experience and expertise, they will be expected to lead the Federal GR team’s work on some of these issues, liaising with business representatives to ensure alignment with business priorities and set expectations for the achievement of the GR team’s work assignments. Therefore, this individual will be expected to conduct detailed research into relevant policy issues and provide substantive policy analysis accordingly. They will also participate in trade associations on PayPal’s behalf.
Experience required:
Typically requires a minimum of 12 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 8 years and a Master’s degree; or a PhD with 5 years experience; or equivalent experience. Barriers to entry may require committee review.
Proven ability to advocate before Members of Congress and the Administration.
Experience in Payments, Global Financial Services, Consumer/Retail Banks, eCommerce, Information Technology.
A deep interest and proven understanding of how public policy impacts business, with know-how and experience in the area of financial services, payments, ecommerce and technology.
An appreciation for technology; its applications and uses, in order to gain greater insight of regulatory requirements.
Demonstrated experience in the management of tools and information for large teams, including shared document libraries and reports.
Excellence in written presentation skills and an ability to work with different team styles, and to incorporate those into formats that those teams are comfortable working with.
Work experience with a matrix-styled organization, understanding how to successfully navigate through the organization in order to partner internally.
Excellent written, verbal, communicative and influencing skills.
Character and Competencies:
Exemplary understanding of how to develop strong, candid and advantageous relationships within the company in order to leverage resources in order to effect legislative and policy changes.
A high level of corporate professionalism, maturity and political agility; analyze, negotiate, and influence appropriately.
Able to work flexibly under pressure and balance multiple and competing tasks, energetic drive, able to take ownership of the process and outcome.
Brings out the best in others to perform beyond the norm.
Remain resilient through adversity and can achieve results despite challenging situations.
Consistently exercise sound judgment under stringent deadlines, possess significant degree of self-motivation and resourcefulness.
Execute decisively when necessary, comfortable with the ambiguity of the regulatory and legislative process.
Sound management and judgement skills, resourceful, confident, able to listen and work collaboratively.
An uncompromising level of ethical commitment and integrity.
A high level of self-awareness, seeks feedback and acts on it, as well as a good sense of humor.
Our Benefits:
At PayPal, we’re committed to building an equitable and inclusive global economy. And we can’t do this without our most important asset—you. That’s why we offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. We champion your financial, physical, and mental health by offering valuable benefits and resources to help you care for the whole you.

Overview:

Bowhead seeks a Speechwriter to support The Office of the Assistant Secretary of the Army (Acquisition, Logistics and Technology) (OASA(ALT)) located in Washington, DC. The Speechwriter shall provide support required to assist in the development and preparation of speeches, presentations, and written articles for the AAE, PMILDEP, PDASA and others as directed by the ASA(ALT), Chief of Staff and Strategic Communications office. Products may be, but are not limited to, verbal or written products, formal or informal reports, briefing charts and slides, and other brochures. These are required to be completed in various media as determined by the Government. Applies knowledge of the various programs, missions, and functions of OASA(ALT) organizations as they relate to the functions and programs to which assigned. Will liaise directly with the Chief of Staff office to support senior Acquisition leaders in the development and publication of required products.
Responsibilities:
Research, draft, edit, and finalize speeches and talking points for internal and external speaking engagements to include conferences, think tank engagements, media roundtables, and other events.
Collaborate closely with OASA(ALT) leaders, advisors, and the strategic communications team to prepare and finalize remarks based on leader guidance and research of Army senior leader public speeches and statements.
Conduct extensive research on specific topics to be included in speeches and talking points to discuss with OASA(ALT) leaders and coordinate issues with OASA(ALT)’s subject matter experts to clearly articulate complex topics in understandable terms for maximum audience impact.
Manage timely rewrites of feedback from both OASA(ALT)’s leadership and the strategic communications team.
Research and prepare in final format Op-Eds, articles, and other external communications documents as required by OASA(ALT) leadership.
Draft and finalize scripts for pre-recorded remarks by OASA(ALT) leaders.
Collaborate with the strategic communications team, to support other writing requirements as they arise.
Qualifications:

In accordance with Executive Order 14042: Ensuring Adequate COVID Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors, candidates should be aware that they may be required to have received or be willing to receive the COVID-19 vaccine by date of hire.
Bachelor’s degree in English, Journalism, or relevant field.
Minimum of 5 years of relevant work experience.
Solid editing ability according to AP Style Guide.
Exceptional ability and creativity to communicate complex acquisition and acquisition-related issues to the public and media in a clear, concise, and persuasive manner.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision, and also within a collaborative team environment.
Flexibility to work under tight deadlines, strong analytical and time-management skills, and an ability to problem solve difficult and complex issues,
Excellent writing skills and precise attention to detail.
Physical Demands:

Must be able to lift up to 25 pounds
Must be able to stand and walk for prolonged amounts of timeMust be able to twist, bend, and squat periodically
SECURITY CLEARANCE REQUIRED: Must be able to maintain a security clearance at the Secret level. US Citizenship is a requirement for Secret clearance at this location.
